text: My role is to help customers design

new systems and support them
throughout the lifecycle of launching it.

I worked with a customer recently who is
designing a personal safety application.
The application enabled people

to be tracked
and traced throughout the night,

making sure that if they were
in a dangerous situation,

they could get in contact
with someone nearby

and get emergency services to respond
in case they were in danger.

The main challenges with an application
like this is having something

available, having people there
all the time that you can contact.
When it comes to personal safety,

getting straight through to
someone is of utmost importance.
With a lot of legacy systems,
this doesn't come with high availability.
We rely on single forms of communication.

By using AWS, we can expand that further,
making sure that their contact centers

were available at all times,
even if one server happened to go down.
For people who are using the app,

this means that they can continue
using it,

go out on their
nights, and have that safety in their back
pocket, ready in case something happens.
Looking at this customer,

we needed to make sure that they worked
as efficiently as possible.
Whether it's by optimizing

and moving things
from working with servers into serverless,
optimizing for cost and efficiency

to ensure
that there's the best customer experience,

most efficiently

Before, customers

even if one area goes down,
there will be another contact

Once you've launched, it's important
to make sure that you're reviewing

making sure to look where
